bibl.title: State of Nebraska DEPARTMENT OF Trade and Commerce Bureau of Insurance Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1930

p.seg: State of Nebraska DEPARTMENT OF Trade and Commerce Bureau of Insurance Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1930 Also Comparative Figures of Authorized Companies for the years 1927, 1928 and 1929.

To His Excellency, Governor Charles "W. Bryan: We respectfully submit the summary of business of companies authorized to write Insurance m this State for the year ending De - cember 31, l!) 30. DEPARTMENT OF TRADE AND COMMERCE, E. H. LUIKAUT, Deputy Secretary. LEE HEUDMAN, ■ Acting Commissioner of Insurance and Securities.

COMPANIES ORGANIZED IN NEBRASKA FROM JANUARY 1, 1030, TO JUNE 1. 1081. . Central Catholic Casualty Company, (Assessment) Columbus, Nebr. Licensed April 26, 1930, to write: Accident and Health insurance. Cornbelt Life Insurance Company, (Stock) Sharp Building, Lincoln, Nebr. Licensed January 8, 1931, to write: ■ Life insurance. Farm Theft Mutual Insurance Company, (Mutual) • 223 Sharp Building. Lincoln, Nebr. Licensed April 12, 1930, to write: Poultry and Live Stock Theft insurance. First American Insurance Company, (Changed plan from Assessment to Mutual) 602 Sharp Building. Lincoln. Nebr. Licensed February 5, 1930, to write: Accident and Health insurance. First National Indemnity Company. (Assessment). 408-9 Omaha Loan Building, Omaha, Nebr. _^ Licensed July 9. 1930, to write: Accident and Health insurance. Grain Growers Hail Insurance Company, ( Assessment) 237 North Tenth Street, Lincoln, Nebraska. Licensed May 16, 1931 to write: Hail Insurance. Great Western Hail Insurance Company. (Assessment) 314 First National Bank Building, Lincoln, Nebr. Licensed March 6. 1930, to write: Hail insurance. Nebraska Farmers Mutual Reinsurance Assn. (Assessment) Wahoo. Nebr. Licensed April 14. 1931 to write: Fire, Lightning, and Tornado. Nebraska State Health and Accident Insurance Company (Assessment) (Changed name to Pawnee Insurance Company,) Grand Island. Nebr. Licensed March 29. 1930, to write: Accident and Health insurance. United Hall Insurance Company, (Assessment) 304 Peters Trust Building, Omaha, Nebr. Licensed July 23, 1930, to write: Hail Insurance. Wheat Belt Hail Insurance Company, (Assessment) 703 Terminal Building, Lincoln, Nebr. Licensed May 1, 1931, to write: Hail insurance.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES REINSURING, MERGING, OR WITHDRAWING FROM NEBRASKA FROM JANUARY 1, 1930, TO JUNE 1, 1931. 'American Old Line Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, merged with the Calumet National Life Insurance Company, Chicago, Illinois, February 4, 1930. The latter company changed its name - to American Old Line Insurance Company and merged with the . Ohio National Life Insurance Company, Cincinnati, Ohio, January 8, 1931. Atlas Casualty Company, Chicago and Fort 'Wayne, was reinsured by the Public Indemnity Co., Newark, N. J., May 1, 1931. Belt Automobile Indemnity Association, Chicago, Illinois, merged with the Belt Casualty Company, Chicago, Illinois, December 31, 1930. Boohe County Farmers Mutual Insurance Company, Albion, Nebraska, dissolved June 3, 1930. . ' Business Men's Protective Association, Lincoln, Nebraska, was re - insured by the Prudential Casualty and Surety Company, St. Louis, Mo., March 13, 1930. Elkhorn Life and Accident Insurance Company, Norfolk, Nebraska, was reinsured by the Pacific States Life Insurance Company, Holly - wood, California, December 8, 1930. Epperson Underwriters, Kansas City, Mo., cancelled its business Oc - tober 15, 1930. Business was re-written m Lumbermen's Under - • . writing Alliance, Kansas City, Mo. Farm Central Mutual Fire Insurance Company, Hastings, Nebraska, was reinsured by" the Farmers Mutual Insurance Company of Ne - braska, Lincoln, Nebraska, December 10, 1930. General Casualty and Surety Company, Detroit, Michigan, was reinsur - ed by the General Indemnity Corporation of America, Rochester, X. V., April 1, 1931. Georgia Casualty Company, Newark, N. J., merged with the Public Indemnity Company, Newark, N. J., July 24, 1930. Hardware Underwriters, Elgin, Illinois, reinsured by the three follow - ing companies, December 31, 1930: Itetail Hardware Mutual Fire Insurance Company, Minneapolis, Minn., Hardware Dealers Mutual Fire Insurance Company, Stev - ens Point, Wis., Minnesota Implement Mutual Fire Insurance Com - pany, Owatonna, Minn. Highways Motor Underwriters, Kansas City, Mo. and Lincoln, Nebr., was reinsured by the Utilities Indemnity Exchange, St. Louis, Mo., Sept. 1, 1930. Lumbermen's Reciprocal Association, Houston, Texas, was placed m t hi'" hands of a Receiver July 31, 1930. Minnesota Fire Insurance Compauy, Chatfleld, Minn, was reinsured by the First National insurance Company, Seattle, Washington, October 31, 1930. Mohawk Fire Insurance Company, New York, N. Y. discontinued busi - ness December 31, 1930. Northern States Life Insurance Co., Hammond, Indiana, withdrew May 1, 1931.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT Reinsurance Life Company of America, Chicago, Illinois, -was reinsur - ed by the Security Life Insurance Company of America, Chicago, Illinois, August 16, 1930. Ridgely Protective Association, Boston, Mass., was reinsured by the Loyal Protective Insurance Company, Boston, Mass., December 31. 1930. Sylvania Insurance Company, Philadelphia, Pa. merged with' Globe Insurance Company of America. Pittsburgh, Pa., October 30, 1030. United States Automobile Insurance Exchange, Kansas City, Mo., with - drew from Nebraska December 31, 1930.

Mountain States Life Insurance Company, Hollywood, California, changed "name to Pacific Slates Life Insurance Company, July 1, Mutual Plate Class Insurance Company, Shelby; Ohio, changed name to Shelby Mutual Plate Glass & Casualty Company, September 23, Mystic Workers of the World, Fulton, Illinois, changed name to Fidelity Life Association, September 30, 1930. Co. of Paris, France, changed name to Union Fire, Accident and General Ins. Co., Feb. 18, 1931. Washington Fidelity National Insurance Company, Chicago, Illinois, changed name to Washington National Insurance Company, Jan - uary 22, 1931.
